subject: Re: list of things

full_threads.body:
Hi Jasmine,

Currently, that is how it is setup for new quotes. I'm assuming your question relates to editing an existing quote. Because Advantage Plus was not option when the existing quotes were originally created, this will not automatically be activated. You will need to manually select which existing quotes you want to offer the Advantage Plus option on. All new quotes will have it enabled by default.

I hope that clears it up?

Hi Joel,



Just to clarify. I think AdvantagePlus should automatically be clicked on and we click off if we don't want them to use Advantageplus? Are you able to do that please.




Kind Regards,



Jasmine Killey

Assistant to Senior Stylist

Advantage Property Styling

Hi Heath Thanks for this. This is great and thanks for the handy video! We have been through it and unfortunately the maths on the Adv Plus isn't working as it should be. In order to address it correctly, can we please do the following:
  • The first two boxes for Adv Plus being "% Premium on Advantage Plus" and "PREMIUM ON ADVANTAGE PLUS (TOTAL)" aren't needed. This is because the way they currently work is they add a hidden premium to all pricing scenarios. This is obviously wrong, if you're only intending the premium to apply to advantage plus. However, in any regard, we currently are NOT showing pricing for Adv Plus as a different pricing regime for the underyling job, so these fields need to go. The premium is set to zero by default.
  • The % paid upfront needs to be changed to % ACTIVATON FEE. The maths on this isn't working - once you accept it deducts the 15% from the total styling fee payable on settlement which is wrong. The Total Styling fee is still payable entirely at settlement. See current platform for the correct maths…
  • In terms of the quote output, the boxes have the total, but they do need to say 'Upfront Amount: $[xx.xx]'. I feel it is misleading not to say this. I also wonder whether the Adv Plus box needs to say 'At Settlement: $[styling fee]' and below that a third line being 'If you don't sell: $0.00'. Just for completeness.
Feel free to call me if you'd like to work through any of the above issues. Regards Dan Dan Gerber Managing Director Advantage Property Styling Follow us on: M 0412 955 531 | P 02 9310 1611 Tenancy 1, Unit 1, 14A Baker Street, BANKSMEADOW NSW 2019 www.advantagestyling.com.au

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body: @joel

Hi Heath

For ease of reference, I thought I would aggregate a list of the changes we wanted to make to our proposal platform and website:

· The GREEN ones are ready to go and I don’t feel need any further discussion or instruction (although happy to discuss if you’d like!)
· The YELLOW ones need some discussion so we can agree the best fix.
· The RED ones are just a placemarker. We need to work through internally before coming to you. Simply flagging them.

Task
Description
Proposal Platform – Advantage Plus. Ability to flex the activation fee from 15%
Ability to change the Activation Fee. In future we may need to do more or less than 15%, so if would be good if there was a box that defaulted to 15% but we could change it. Just to reiterate, the Activation Fee is separate from the styling fee. In all instances, 100% of the styling fee is due if the home sells.
Proposal Platform – Remove Advantage Plus as a payment option if we want to
We need an ability to flick a switch at the back end which entirely REMOVES the Advantage Plus element from quote as an option. It can flick ZIP Money back in possibly but there are some credits we DO NOT wish to take the risk on.
Proposal Platform – Front page of quote (i.e. before acceptance)
Front page of quote. In the various payment option boxes right down the bottom, I would like to if possible put in the amount they would pay up front. So for the first 2 boxes (CC and EFT) it would be the full amount e.g. “Up-front amount: $1,000”. Whereas for Advantage Plus it would simply say “Up-front amount: $150”
Proposal Platform – Final thank you screen mods
I would like to make this screen a bit more friendly from a user perspective and also include an offer from our partners (taxi box, Glenco and possible a removalist). This is a design modification to the thank you screen with a standardised ‘tick the box’ for services from our partners
Proposal Platform – API into ListSure
We are working with an external credit provider who insures and funds Advantage Plus. What we would like to do is an API which pushes certain fields FROM THE CLIENT PROPOSAL ACCEPTANCE into ListSure’s portal. Similar to what we have done for the stripe integration.
Website – menu items
I would like to add Advantage Plus somewhere really prominent on the menu and home page. Let’s discuss the best option.
I think we also need to do something with the menu situation. On some screens and laptops these arrows turn up which make the menu bar really ‘thick’ and it doesn’t look good.
Google Reviews
We are about to turn off our TrustPilot service. It is simply too expensive. We need to automate some kind of review process for our customers. I’d like to chat with you about how we could do this.
Proposal Platform – Advantage Plus customers, Automatic Letter to Solicitors
People electing Advantage Plus are giving us a solicitor’s direction – this will go to the solicitor in the form of a letter or email with a formal direction that on settlement we are to be paid our styling fee. I would like to automate this. We collect all the info at the time the client accepts ADV Plus as their payment options, but let’s discussion how best to do this.
Website – partner page
An and I can work on this probably. We will give you a shout if we need any help.



Dan Gerber
Managing Director
Advantage Property Styling
